Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Band Council's decision to withhold loan payments is subject to judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Indirect communication of the BCR in November 2001; delay in filing until September 2003
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish standing and justiciability
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not applicable – no credibility assessment made
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Judicial review applies only to public law matters involving federal boards, commissions, or tribunals
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness and correctness (as applicable to federal administrative bodies)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Untimeliness of application and lack of procedural fairness duty
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of statutory duty and request for enforcement of loan payments
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim failed on merits due to private law nature of dispute
Crimes.Review_Standard: Amenability to judicial review under public law principles
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No procedural duty owed by Third Party Manager to applicant
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of the loan agreement, BCR content, timing of notice
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Public vs. private law distinction under Canadian administrative law
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to validity of BCR and request for mandamus/receiver
Crimes.Court_Result: Dismissal for lack of standing and non-justiciability
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Courts Act, common law on judicial review
Crimes.Defendant_Response: BCR was a private commercial decision not subject to judicial review
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial determination on jurisdiction and standing
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of standing, untimeliness, private law character
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Judicial review process under federal law
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Request for enforcement of loan payments
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court jurisdiction over federal boards/tribunals
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Judicial review limited to public law decisions with statutory authority

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Commercial loan repayment dispute framed as potential fraud
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Lawfulness of BCR withholding payments and timeliness of judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Post-litigation enforcement attempt via judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No finding of fraudulent intent; matter treated as contractual
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged unlawful interference with contractual rights through BCR
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Timeliness and justiciability under judicial review
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Delay in filing (beyond 30-day window) and private law nature
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Rules under Federal Courts Act regarding time limits
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to file within 30 days without justification
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether the dispute involves public legal duties
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None explicitly noted – court assessed available evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Judicial review applicable only to public law matters
Crimes.Application_Factor: Timing of knowledge of BCR (November 2001) vs. filing (September 2003)
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Dismissal for lack of standing and delay
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Amenability of BCR to judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Federal Courts Act – time limits and scope of review
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Private contractual dispute not subject to judicial review; late filing
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Timing and method of notification of BCR
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No procedural duty found toward applicant
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not central – decision based on legal characterization
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Dispute is private, not public; no standing; out of time
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Late filing and lack of standing
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Lack of standing, untimeliness, private law character
